This is a simple demonstration of the use of Cairo's CairoContext::arc() method, drawing a black 135 degree arc.
See also: Arc Negative

This is a simple demonstration of the use of Cairo's CairoContext::arcNegative() method, drawing a black 225 degree arc by defining a 135 arc but drawing with the arcNegative method instead of the arc method.
See also: Arc

Shown here is the effect of clipping on the surface, as both the cross and the black background actually span over the size of the whole canvas but only the area masked by the arc and then clipped using CairoContext::clip() is shown.
See also: Clip Image

Shown here is the effect of clipping on an ImageSurface, as the circle is clipped out it is the only area left visible, the surrounding gray area is in fact transparent.
See also: Clip
This demonstrates how a curved rectangle could be realized if desired. The code shown is potentially capable of being packed into a php function.
